required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Slipping Rib Syndrome: A Clinical Entity to Consider in Chest Pain
clinical_study.official_title: Slipping Rib Syndrome: A Clinical Entity to Consider in Chest Pain

brief_summary.textblock: Slipping rib syndrome consists on false or floating ribs hypermobility, whose can force the ribs to come in contact with each other. The authors reported a fourteen case series presenting a slipping rib syndrome.

detailed_description.textblock:
Slipping rib syndrome consists on false or floating ribs hypermobility, whose can force the ribs to come in contact with each other.
The authors reported a fourteen case series presenting a slipping rib syndrome. Mean age 35.00 ± 10.66 years old; 64.29% men.
The 10th rib level was the most predominant, affecting 64.29% of cases. Dynamic ultrasound was the gold standard diagnostic tool. Different conservative treatments were applied in most of cases.

primary_outcome.description: Level of costal rib where there is hypermobility

secondary_outcome.description: If the subject participates in some kind of sport activity
Pain mechanism could be "repetitive movement", "trauma" or "pregnancy"
Time of delay in have a diagnosis (in years)

intervention.description: Diagnosis was based on clinic suspicion and positive ultrasonography dynamic maneuvers by reproducing pain and slipping rib exam

study_pop.textblock: Patients affected with Slipping rib syndrome

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients presenting costal pain around 9th, 10th, or 11th rib.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients younger than 18 years old and older than 80 years old.

overall_official.affiliation: Consell Català de l'Esport. Generalitat de l'Esport. Barcelona. Spain.

facility.name: DCR Trauma Group. Moreres Medical Center. Clínica Sagrada Família.

reference.citation: Saltzman DA, Schmitz ML, Smith SD, Wagner CW, Jackson RJ, Harp S. The slipping rib syndrome in children. Paediatr Anaesth. 2001 Nov;11(6):740-3.

Mooney DP, Shorter NA. Slipping rib syndrome in childhood. J Pediatr Surg. 1997 Jul;32(7):1081-2.

Turcios NL. Slipping rib syndrome in an adolescent: an elusive diagnosis. Clin Pediatr (Phila). 2013 Sep;52(9):879-81. doi: 10.1177/0009922812469290. Epub 2012 Dec 12.

Van Tassel D, McMahon LE, Riemann M, Wong K, Barnes CE. Dynamic ultrasound in the evaluation of patients with suspected slipping rib syndrome. Skeletal Radiol. 2019 May;48(5):741-751. doi: 10.1007/s00256-018-3133-z. Epub 2019 Jan 5.
